critique: The document is a formal order regarding the appointment of Mrs. Mabel P. Hollister to a position in the Smithsonian Institution. It mentions the death of her husband, Mr. Ned Hollister, and the circumstances surrounding his death. The document also mentions that [NAME] has passed civil service examinations. Given the formal nature of the document, the emotions conveyed are subtle. There is a hint of sadness due to the mention of Mr. Hollister's death, but it is presented in a factual manner. There is a slight sense of joy that Mrs. Hollister may be appointed to an appropriate position. There is no explicit anger, fear, disgust, or surprise conveyed in the document. The initial scores reflect these observations, with sadness and joy being slightly higher than the other emotions. The revised scores are similar to the initial scores, with minor adjustments to reflect the subtle emotions conveyed.
